conclusion: To determine if the rate distribution curve changes during D to A, analyze gas properties.
Process Dâ†’A appears isochoric as volume remains constant while pressure increases.
Since volume is constant and pressure increases, temperature increases from D to A.
Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution depends on gas temperature.
As temperature increases, the distribution curve shifts to higher speeds and broadens.
The rate distribution curve changes during D to A due to temperature increase.
